items.title: Why Bear Notes sucks
items.content_html:
Those guys who wrote Bear say that you should buy ‚Äúpro‚Äù subscription to get synchronization of your notes between your devices.

They lie.

Bear stores all your notes in the single file, which actually is a SQL database, and it‚Äôs in your iCloud. And your OS is syncing it anyway! You pay your money just for permission to use this already-synced file. Okay, I am ready to do it once and unblock this feature forever, but to pay yearly or even monthly?!

Moreover, if you run out of iCloud storage with this file, you should pay for extra space separately!

Are you guys crazy? No way!

items.title: üí¨ From ¬´Surely You‚Äôre Joking, Mr. Feynman¬ª (by himself)
items.content_html:
I often liked to play tricks on people when I was at MIT. One time, in mechanical drawing class, some joker picked up a French curve (a piece of plastic for drawing smooth curves¬†‚Äî a curly, funny-looking thing) and said, ¬´I wonder if the curves on this thing have some special formula?¬ª

I thought for a moment and said, ¬´Sure they do. The curves are very special curves. Lemme show ya¬ª, and I picked up my French curve and began to turn it slowly. ¬´The French curve is made so that at the lowest point on each curve, no matter how you turn it, the tangent is horizontal.¬ª

All the guys in the class were holding their French curve up at different angles, holding their pencil up to it at the lowest point and laying it along, and discovering that, sure enough, the tangent is horizontal. They were all excited by this ¬´discovery¬ª¬†‚Äî even though they had already gone through a certain amount of calculus and had already ¬´learned¬ª that the derivative (tangent) of the minimum (lowest point) of any curve is zero (horizontal). They didn‚Äòt put two and two together. They didn‚Äòt even know what they ¬´knew¬ª.

I don‚Äòt know what‚Äòs the matter with people: they don‚Äòt learn by understanding; they learn by some other way¬†‚Äî by rote, or something. Their knowledge is so fragile!
